content:
“he shall take care that the laws be faithfully executed”
draws comparison to congress’ necessary and proper clause

the president has the authority to take care that the laws congress passes are executed
the president would pass executive orders based on the recommendations of the cabinet department that was helping them with the new law that congress passed to begin to execute that law
checked: an executive order can be overturned by congress if they feel that they don’t feel that the president is doing what they want it
	they can overturn it by passing a law that redirects it, or the supreme court can overturn it as well

big idea: executive orders for president to help them take care that the laws congress passes are executed
